chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> forall p : Z, P p

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
lt_absZ = fun x y : Z => ltZ (absZ x) (absZ y) : Z -> Z -> Prop
Zrec4 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> forall p : nat, and_recZ p P
Zrec1 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> P OZ
Zrec2 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> and_recZ 0 P
Zrec3 : forall (P : Z -> Set) (p : nat), (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> and_recZ p P -> and_recZ (S p) P
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
ssrbool.prop_in1 : forall T1 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> forall P : T1 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop
and_set_set_set_rec : forall (S1 S2 : Set) (P : and_set_set_set S1 S2 -> Set), (forall (s : S2) (s0 : S1), P (and_set_set_set_i S1 S2 s s0)) -> forall a : and_set_set_set S1 S2, P a
ssrbool.prop_on1 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall (f : T1 -> T2) (Pf : (T1 -> T2) -> T3) (P : T1 -> Prop), ssreflect.phantom T3 (Pf f) -> ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop
plus_le_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n + p <= m + p
tech_lt_abs_OZ : forall x : Z, lt_absZ x (pos 0) -> x = OZ
BinInt.Z.add_assoc : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add n (BinInt.Z.add m p) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add n m) p
BinInt.Z.add_shuffle0 : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add n m) p = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add n p) m
BinInt.Z.mul_assoc : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.mul n (BinInt.Z.mul m p) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.mul n m) p
BinInt.Z.bits_inj' : forall a b : BinNums.Z, (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.testbit a n = BinInt.Z.testbit b n) -> a = b
minus_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, m < n -> Init.Nat.pred (n - m) = n - S m
lt_OZ : forall m : Z, ~ ltZ (absZ m) OZ
Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m
BinInt.Z.mul_add_distr_l : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.mul n (BinInt.Z.add m p) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul n m) (BinInt.Z.mul n p)
BinInt.Z.shiftr_spec : forall a n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 m -> BinInt.Z.testbit (BinInt.Z.shiftr a n) m = BinInt.Z.testbit a (BinInt.Z.add m n)
Nat.add_le_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> n + p <= m + p
BinInt.Z.add_cancel_l : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add p n = BinInt.Z.add p m < -> n = m
and_recZ = fun (p : nat) (P : Z -> Set) => forall n : nat, n <= p -> and_set_set_set (P (pos n)) (P (neg n)) : nat -> (Z -> Set) -> Set Arguments and_recZ _%nat_scope _%function_scope
Nat.lt_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n < m -> n <= m
gt_S_le : forall n m : nat, S m > n -> n <= m
gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
tech_pos_not_posZ : forall n m : nat, n <> m -> pos n <> pos m
lt_minus2 : forall n m : nat, n < m -> 0 < m - n
Znat.Z2N.inj_max : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.to_N (BinInt.Z.max n m) = BinNat.N.max (BinInt.Z.to_N n) (BinInt.Z.to_N m)
le_opp_OZ : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = OZ
le_opp_OZ2 : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = y
tech_le_pos_abs : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> absZ x = x
le_opp_OZ_l : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> leZ (oppZ x) OZ
lt_succ : forall n m : nat, n <= S m -> {n <= m} + {n = S m}
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
ssreflect.nary_congruence_statement : nat -> (forall B : Type, (B -> B -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop
antisym : forall A : Set, (A -> A -> Prop) -> Prop

``` 
intros P H n p. apply (Z_rec P (Zrec1 P) (Zrec2 P) (Zrec3 P) p).
```

original: intros P H n p. apply (Z_rec P (Zrec1 P) (Zrec2 P) (Zrec3 P) p).
